meanings.definition: A person or thing that continues or persists.
meanings.sent1: The old clock was a continuants in the hallway, always ticking away.
meanings.sent2: The river was a continuants, flowing steadily through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The little ant was a continuants, never giving up on carrying the heavy crumb.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was a continuants, unwavering and enduring.
meanings.sent5: The oak tree stood as a continuants, standing tall through all seasons.

meanings.definition: Sounds produced without any interruption in the flow of breath.
meanings.sent1: The humming of the bees was a soft continuants in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The gentle breeze created a peaceful continuants in the air.
meanings.sent3: The purring of the cat was a comforting continuants in the room.
meanings.sent4: The distant sound of waves crashing was a soothing continuants in the night.
meanings.sent5: The chirping of crickets filled the evening with a continuous continuants.
